titleStmt.title: The world's mistake in Oliver Cromwell, or, A short political discourse shewing that Cromwell's mal-administration, during his four years and nine moneths pretended protectorship, layed the foundation of our present condition in the decay of trade.
titleStmt.author: Bethel, Slingsby, 1617-1697.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Slingsby Bethel. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.)
Title page has inverted triangle of 16 ornaments between rules.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
